entry.title: Combined summary - A Comparison Of LN and Drivechain Security In The Presence Of 51% Attackers
entry.summary: ZmnSCPxj, a developer in the bitcoin community, presented a quiz in a bitcoin-dev email thread to test knowledge of Drivechain. The quiz covered various topics such as the security model, withdrawal system, and potential drawbacks of Drivechain. It discussed parameters "m" and "b," representing how much people want to kill a sidechain and how much profit a mainchain miner expects from supporting a sidechain, respectively.The quiz also touched on how m can be above one, how DC is designed to deter sc-theft, and how the BTC network might become uncompetitive. If successful, Altcoin-investors would be harmed, and two Maximalist-groups would also be slightly harmed, though it did not identify these groups. Paul and ZmnSCPxj had an email conversation discussing this quiz.The quiz aimed to identify those who are knowledgeable about Drivechain. It also discussed types of people who should use the withdrawal system and how users can move coins from chain to chain. ZmnSCPxj confirmed that a 51% miner can only attack LN channels in which it is a participant, while it can simultaneously attack all Drivechain-based sidechains and steal all of their funds. However, both LN and Drivechain use their design to deter theft.Users should be free to decide what risks they take with their money and be allowed to spend their BTC to a Bip300 script, just as they are allowed to open an LN channel. Overall, the quiz provided valuable insights into the workings and potential drawbacks of Drivechain technology.
